question: Match the following (Bryophytes structure & reproduction):
column_I: Differentiation level in bryophytes compared to algae
matches: Differentiation level in bryophytes compared to algae–More differentiated
Attachment of bryophyte plant body–Thallus-like and prostrate or erect
Bryophyte root-like structures–Unicellular or multicellular rhizoids
Main plant body of bryophyte–Haploid
Sex organs in bryophytes–Multicellular
answer: Differentiation level in bryophytes compared to algae–More differentiated, Attachment of bryophyte plant body–Thallus-like and prostrate or erect, Bryophyte root-like structures–Unicellular or multicellular rhizoids, Main plant body of bryophyte–Haploid, Sex organs in bryophytes–Multicellular

question: Match the following (Bryophyte gametangia & fertilisation):
column_II: An antherozoid fuses with the egg to produce the zygote
matches: Male sex organ in bryophytes–Antheridium
Female sex organ in bryophytes–Archegonium
Structure of archegonium–Flask-shaped
Fertilisation in bryophytes–An antherozoid fuses with the egg to produce the zygote
Product of fertilisation–Zygote
answer: Male sex organ in bryophytes–Antheridium, Female sex organ in bryophytes–Archegonium, Structure of archegonium–Flask-shaped, Fertilisation in bryophytes–An antherozoid fuses with the egg to produce the zygote, Product of fertilisation–Zygote

question: Match the following (Bryophyte sporophyte & spores):
column_II: Attached to the photosynthetic gametophyte and derives nourishment from it
Do not undergo reduction division immediately
matches: Zygote development–Do not undergo reduction division immediately
Sporophyte dependence–Attached to the photosynthetic gametophyte and derives nourishment from it
Spore production process–Meiosis
Fate of haploid spores–Germinate to produce gametophyte
Function of sporophyte–Produce haploid spores
answer: Zygote development–Do not undergo reduction division immediately, Sporophyte dependence–Attached to the photosynthetic gametophyte and derives nourishment from it, Spore production process–Meiosis, Fate of haploid spores–Germinate to produce gametophyte, Function of sporophyte–Produce haploid spores

question: Match the following (Bryophyte ecology):
column_II: Reduce the impact of falling rain and prevent soil erosion
Used as fuel and packing material due to water-holding capacity
Decompose rocks making the substrate suitable for growth of higher plants
matches: Sphagnum–Used as fuel and packing material due to water-holding capacity
Mosses and lichens–Colonise rocks
Ecological role of mosses–Decompose rocks making the substrate suitable for growth of higher plants
Soil protection by mosses–Reduce the impact of falling rain and prevent soil erosion
Bryophyte groups–Liverworts and mosses
answer: Sphagnum–Used as fuel and packing material due to water-holding capacity, Mosses and lichens–Colonise rocks, Ecological role of mosses–Decompose rocks making the substrate suitable for growth of higher plants, Soil protection by mosses–Reduce the impact of falling rain and prevent soil erosion, Bryophyte groups–Liverworts and mosses

question: Match the following (Liverwort structure & reproduction):
column_II: Dorsiventral and closely appressed to the substrate
Moist, shady habitats such as banks of streams, marshy ground, damp soil, bark of trees and deep in the woods
Gemma cups located on the thalli
Produced either on the same or on different thalli
matches: Liverwort habitat–Moist, shady habitats such as banks of streams, marshy ground, damp soil, bark of trees and deep in the woods
Structure of liverwort thallus–Dorsiventral and closely appressed to the substrate
Gemmae development site–Gemma cups located on the thalli
Gemmae type–Green, multicellular, asexual buds
Sex organ location in liverworts–Produced either on the same or on different thalli
answer: Liverwort habitat–Moist, shady habitats such as banks of streams, marshy ground, damp soil, bark of trees and deep in the woods, Structure of liverwort thallus–Dorsiventral and closely appressed to the substrate, Gemmae development site–Gemma cups located on the thalli, Gemmae type–Green, multicellular, asexual buds, Sex organ location in liverworts–Produced either on the same or on different thalli

question: Match the following (Marchantia & leafy liverworts):
column_II: Spores are produced within the capsule
Tiny leaf-like appendages in two rows on the stem-like structures
matches: Marchantia–Thalloid plant body
Leafy liverworts–Tiny leaf-like appendages in two rows on the stem-like structures
Sporophyte parts in liverworts–Foot, seta and capsule
Spore production in liverworts–Spores are produced within the capsule
Gametophyte formation–Free-living gametophytes
answer: Marchantia–Thalloid plant body, Leafy liverworts–Tiny leaf-like appendages in two rows on the stem-like structures, Sporophyte parts in liverworts–Foot, seta and capsule, Spore production in liverworts–Spores are produced within the capsule, Gametophyte formation–Free-living gametophytes
